input: question: Who began the revolution of Greek influenced architecture in Britain? [SEP] sentence: From the middle of the 18th century, exploration and publication changed the course of British architecture towards a purer vision of the Ancient Greco-Roman ideal.
question: Where do the watersheds divide at? [SEP] sentence: The watersheds divide at Triple Divide Peak in Glacier National Park.

question: Where did Kanye receive a scholarship to attend? [SEP] sentence: After graduating from high school, West received a scholarship to attend Chicago's American Academy of Art in 1997 and began taking painting classes, but shortly after transferred to Chicago State University to study English.

question: Has a woman ever broadcast a match? [SEP] sentence: ESPN bought the competition for the 2010–11 to 2012–13 season and during this time Rebecca Lowe became the first woman to host the FA Cup Final in the UK.

question: What kind of diet may require more than 15mg of zinc daily? [SEP] sentence: There is some evidence to suggest that more than the US RDA (15 mg) of zinc daily may be needed in those whose diet is high in phytates, such as some vegetarians.
question: When did the mandolin appears on Crete? [SEP] sentence: It appeared on Crete around the time of the Venetian rule of the island.

question: Who did Apple pay expensive consulting fees to before doing in-house work? [SEP] sentence: Apple instead brought the design work in-house by establishing the Apple Industrial Design Group, becoming responsible for crafting a new look for all Apple products.

question: What type of servo-controlled systems use pancake motors? [SEP] sentence: Due to the variety of constructions now available, the technology is used in applications from high temperature military to low cost pump and basic servos.

question: Who wanted to grow Seattle by 60% by 2040? [SEP] sentence: In 2006, after growing by 4,000 citizens per year for the previous 16 years, regional planners expected the population of Seattle to grow by 200,000 people by 2040.

question: Santa Monica plans on water independence by what year? [SEP] sentence: An urban runoff facility (SMURFF), the first of its kind in the US, catches and treats 3.5 million US gallons (13,000 m3) of water each week that would otherwise flow into the bay via storm-drains and sells it back to end-users within the city for reuse as gray-water, while bio-swales throughout the city allow rainwater to percolate into and replenish the groundwater supply.

question: In what year was the famous The New Haven Green founded? [SEP] sentence: The New Haven Green, one of the National Historic Landmarks, was formed in 1638, and is home to three 19th-century churches.

question: What is the aggregate population of Paris? [SEP] sentence: Since the 19th century, the built-up area of Paris has grown far beyond its administrative borders; together with its suburbs, the whole agglomeration has a population of 10,550,350 (Jan. 2012 census).

question: Aside from Walpole, who else denied that there was no such thing as the prime minister? [SEP] sentence: George II and George III made strenuous efforts to reclaim the personal power of the monarch, but the increasing complexity and expense of government meant that a minister who could command the loyalty of the Commons was increasingly necessary.

question: What is the frequency of Haplogroup R1a in Russia? [SEP] sentence: The correlation between R1a1a [M17] and the speakers of Indo-European languages, particularly those of Eastern Europe (Russian) and Central and Southern Asia, was noticed in the late 1990s.

question: Are adolescents with authoritative parents more or less likely to complete secondary education by age 22? [SEP] sentence: A study conducted by Adalbjarnardottir and Blondal (2009) showed that adolescents at the age of 14 who identify their parents as authoritative figures are more likely to complete secondary education by the age of 22—as support and encouragement from an authoritative parent motivates the adolescence to complete schooling to avoid disappointing that parent.

question: In October 2010, who was the Nobel laureate that explained how the U.S. Federal Reserve was creating currency to combat the liquidity trap? [SEP] sentence: This was the largest liquidity injection into the credit market, and the largest monetary policy action, in world history.
